inclusion.criterion: A diagnosis of AMD with choroidal neovascularization (CNV) in one eye
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: a. Not previously treated with anti-VEGF injections; or b. On anti-VEGF injections for at least 3 months, and meets criteria for a repeat injection; or c. Patients, who have completed Study 001, may enter this trial at the point of initiation of the month of treatment with the dose of carbidopa-levodopa, that they received in Study 001
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Normal or dry AMD of any grade in the second eye
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to maintain AREDS vitamin supplements throughout the study, or remain off these supplements for the duration of the study, if not taking them prior to the study
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any current use of L-DOPA containing medication or dopamine agonist medication, or any planned use of any of these agents, except for study medication, during the study
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Concurrent use of monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibitors
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any eye condition, disease, or history of trauma in either eye, which can impair vision, except cataract or cataract surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: BCVA worse than 20/60 in the better eye
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Wet AMD in the second eye
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Neurologic conditions which can impair vision
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Significant orthostatic hypotension, defined as a drop in systolic blood pressure, immediately upon changing from the supine to standing position, of >19 mmHg, or a symptomatic drop in systolic blood pressure, immediately upon changing from the supine to standing position
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has Parkinson's Disease and is on Levodopa and Trihexyphenidyl. He experiences slowness of movement and tremors.
